intro: Stigmaphyllon jobertii, commonly known as the Jobert's stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or orange. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
